rule: Use high-density layouts with compact spacing (12-16px gaps) for data-heavy admin screens
rationale: Admin users need to see more data at once to make efficient decisions; reducing whitespace increases data density without sacrificing readability

rule: Support collapsible sidebar navigation with icon-only compact mode
rationale: Admin panels need maximum content area; collapsible sidebars let users reclaim horizontal space when not navigating

rule: All status colors must meet WCAG AA contrast ratio (4.5:1 for normal text)
rationale: Admin interfaces are used for extended periods; poor contrast causes eye strain and accessibility issues

rule: Use 14px base font size for body text in admin interfaces
rationale: Compact admin interfaces benefit from slightly smaller text to fit more content while remaining readable on desktop screens

rule: Data tables must support sorting; filtering; and pagination as baseline features
rationale: Admin users frequently search and organize large datasets; these are non-negotiable table capabilities

rule: Destructive actions (delete; deactivate) must require confirmation dialog
rationale: Accidental data loss in admin panels can have severe business consequences; confirmation prevents costly mistakes

rule: Complex forms should use multi-section layout with clear section headers
rationale: Long admin forms become overwhelming without structure; sections improve scannability and reduce form abandonment

rule: Provide breadcrumb navigation on all detail and edit pages
rationale: Users need context about their location in the admin hierarchy to navigate efficiently and avoid disorientation

rule: Show loading skeletons that match the expected content layout
rationale: Skeleton loaders provide better perceived performance than spinners and reduce layout shift when content loads

rule: Support keyboard navigation and shortcuts for power users
rationale: Admin users perform repetitive tasks; keyboard shortcuts significantly improve productivity and reduce RSI risk

rule: Use a professional blue-gray palette as the primary color scheme for admin interfaces
rationale: Blue conveys trust and professionalism; gray provides neutral backgrounds for data-heavy content

rule: Provide export functionality (CSV/XLSX/PDF) for all data tables
rationale: Admin users need to share and analyze data outside the application; export is a standard admin expectation

rule: Show toast notifications for async operation results (save; delete; update)
rationale: Users need immediate feedback that their actions were processed; toasts provide non-intrusive confirmation

rule: Implement inline validation with clear error messages on form blur
rationale: Immediate validation feedback reduces form submission errors and improves the editing experience

rule: Support dark sidebar with light content area as default admin theme
rationale: Dark sidebars create visual hierarchy between navigation and content areas; reducing cognitive load

rule: Add empty state illustrations with clear call-to-action for new admin sections
rationale: Empty states guide new users and reduce confusion when data hasn't been created yet

rule: Implement command palette (Ctrl+K) for quick navigation in complex admin apps
rationale: Power users benefit greatly from keyboard-driven navigation in applications with many pages

rule: Use 12-column grid system for dashboard widget layouts
rationale: 12-column grids provide maximum flexibility for arranging dashboard widgets at various sizes

rule: Booking CTA buttons must use high-contrast warm colors (orange/amber) with minimum 44px touch target
rationale: Warm colors create urgency and emotional engagement; large touch targets ensure mobile usability for booking actions

rule: Price display must support multi-currency formatting with clear per-night or per-stay labeling
rationale: International travelers need prices in their preferred currency; ambiguous pricing causes booking abandonment

rule: Guest check-in forms must be mobile-optimized and completable within 90 seconds
rationale: Long check-in processes frustrate guests; mobile optimization is essential as most travelers use smartphones

rule: All interactive elements must have minimum 44x44px touch targets for mobile guests
rationale: Travel applications are primarily used on mobile devices; small touch targets cause frustration and errors

rule: Show availability status with clear color coding: green=available; yellow=limited; red=sold out
rationale: Instant visual recognition of availability reduces search time and improves the booking decision process

rule: Use serif fonts for hero headings and hotel names to convey hospitality warmth
rationale: Serif fonts convey tradition and warmth; appropriate for hospitality branding and creating emotional connection

rule: Booking flow must show running total at every step with clear cost breakdown
rationale: Price transparency throughout the booking process builds trust and reduces cart abandonment

rule: Use warm color palette (orange/amber/gold) as primary to create hospitality atmosphere
rationale: Warm colors evoke comfort and invitation; appropriate for hotel and travel brand experiences

rule: Room cards must display hero image; price; rating; and key amenities at minimum
rationale: Travelers make quick decisions based on visual appeal and essential information; missing data slows decision-making
tags: room card image price rating amenity

rule: Date pickers must show pricing per night inline and highlight best-value dates
rationale: Flexible travelers appreciate seeing prices across dates to find the best deal without navigating away

rule: Display guest reviews with star ratings and verified-stay badges
rationale: Social proof through reviews is the most influential factor in hotel booking decisions

rule: Use large; high-quality images throughout the booking experience
rationale: Visual content is the primary decision driver for travel; low-quality images reduce conversion rates

rule: Support autofill for returning guest information in booking forms
rationale: Returning guests should have a faster booking experience; auto-fill reduces friction and increases loyalty

rule: Provide clear cancellation policy information before payment step
rationale: Transparent cancellation policies build trust and reduce post-booking support requests

rule: Show seasonal theme variations in color accents and imagery
rationale: Seasonal theming creates freshness and relevance; encouraging repeat visits to the booking platform

rule: Implement sticky booking summary on scroll for desktop booking flows
rationale: A persistent summary prevents users from losing track of their selection during long booking forms

rule: Offer room comparison feature for indecisive travelers (max 3-4 rooms)
rationale: Comparison tools help travelers make confident decisions by seeing features side-by-side
